page.title: 08STRAWBERRY FARM,BONCHURCH.
page.content: Carrigdene Farm has belonged to Keith and Julie Strevens for 17 years. It is situated at the western end of the Landslip and covers 5 acres of land, some only a few metres from the beach. As well as strawberries, tomatoes, lettuce, aubergines, peppers and melons are grown. These crops need vast quantities of water which comes from a spring and is stored in a tank and 120,000 gallon reservoir and pumped around the farm when needed. The strawberries are grown in plastic tunnels, under glass and uncovered in a walled garden. Casual labour is only employed in the summer to pick approx. 500 lbs of strawberries a day from May until October. A wholesaler distributes the strawberries on the Island and some are sent to the mainland.
